title: Protocol for semisynthesis of serotonylated histone H3 by rapid protein desulfurization in tandem with native chemical ligation
procedures:
Step-by-step method details
Step-by-step method details
Activation of peptidyl hydrazide
Timing: 5 h
This section describes the activation of peptidyl hydrazides to thioesters by acetylacetone (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]), following a similar procedure described by Flood et al.19[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib19]
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/2366-Fig2.jpg
Figure 2. Concise protocol of H3Q5ser semisynthesis via EPL-ADD
See major step 1–42.
Dissolve 3.0 μmol serotonylated H3(1–14)-NHNH2 (5.0 mg) with 0.2 M pH 3 phosphate buffer with 6M GdmCl (600 μL) in a 1.5-mL Eppendorf (EP) tube.
Add 0.12 mmol MPAA (20 mg) to the solution above. The final concentration of MPAA is around 200 mM, and the concentration of peptidyl hydrazide is about 5 mM.
Note: MPAA cannot fully dissolve in this buffer, and a yellowish slurry will be obtained. But the insoluble parts would not affect the thioester formation.
Note: MPAA may have a strong odor/smell. Handle it in the fumehood and wear a mask, goggles and gloves. Spray bleach to distinct its odor once spilled or contacted.
Sonicate the solution to facilitate the dispersion of MPAA.
Add 4.8 μL 0.5 M acetylacetone (2.4 μmol, 0.8 eq.).
Critical: The acetylacetone should be added less than 1 equivalent to the serotonylated H3(1–14)-NHNH2. The remaining acetylacetone will react with the C-terminal Cys15 of truncated H3(15-135), causing uneven protein ligation and inseparable impurity in the end.
Incubate the mixture from step 4 at room temperature (22°C–25°C) for around 5 h.
Monitor the generation of MPAA-thioester by UPLC-MS.
After completion, the MPAA-thioester is subjected to the next step without purification.
Optional: The MPAA-thioester of serotonylated H3(1-14) can be also purified by HPLC at this step.
Note: See troubleshooting 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec6.1].
Expressed protein ligation
Timing: 18 h
This section describes the expressed protein ligation (EPL) between recombinant H3(15-135) and MPAA thioester of H3(1-14) with serotonylation (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]).

Adjust the pH of the MPAA thioester solution above to around 6.0 by 6 M NaOH.
Note: 6 M NaOH aqueous solution is corrosive and irritative. Wear gloves, goggles, and a mask to avoid direct contact with skin and eyes.
Continue to refine the pH of the thioester solution from step 8 to 7.0 by 1 M NaOH carefully.
Critical: Adjusting pH far above 7.0 may cause quantitative hydrolysis of MPAA thioester and self-cyclization. 1 M NaOH solution is recommended instead of the 6 M NaOH solution.
Dilute the solution with 1 mL NCL buffer to around 1.9 mM according to the serotonylated H3(1-14)-NHNH2.
Pipette the MPAA thioester solution to another 2.0-mL eppendorf tube with recombinant H3(15-135) (1.6 mg, 0.11 μmol, 1.0 eq.).
Vortex the mixture until the expressed part is completely dissolved. The final concentration of H3(15-135) is around 1.0 mg/mL (72 μM).
Incubate the ligation at room temperature overnight (22°C–25°C, 8–12 h).
Pipette 20 μL of the step 13 reaction mixture and dilute it with 80 μL 100 mM TCEP solution.
Note: Without addition of TCEP solution, the UPLC-MS spectrum may look messy. See troubleshooting 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec6.3].
Using 1-mL syringe, pass the diluted aliquot through PTFE membrane filter (13 mm × 0.22 μm).
Check the ligation progress by injecting 5 μL of filtered sample into UPLC.
Critical: Make sure all the recombinant part is converted to the ligated product. See troubleshooting 3[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec6.5].
Note: This EPL reaction can be left for 48 h under room temperature (22°C–25°C), but it is recommended to proceed to the next step after the completion of the reaction.
Once the EPL is completed, the reaction can be subjected to the next step directly.
Extraction of 4-Mercaptophenylacetic acid (MPAA)
Timing: 30 min

This section describes the MPAA extraction procedure to minimize the effect of MPAA in the following desulfurization. This step should be done in fumehood as volatile and flammable organic solvents will be involved (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]).
Pipette the EPL solution to a 15-mL centrifuge tube.
Add 230 mg of TCEP·HCl in solid form.
Vortex the mixture until the salt is completely dissolved. The final concentration of TCEP is around 0.5 M.
Note: Some yellow precipitation from MPAA is normal, and it will be removed in the following extraction.
Adjust the solution pH to 3 by 6 M HCl.
Note: Acidic pH facilitates the extraction of MPAA by organic solvent.
Add 2 mL ethyl acetate.
Note: Ethyl acetate is a volatile and flammable liquid. Handle it in the fumehood and wear a mask, gloves, and goggles to avoid any direct contact.
Vortex the bi-layer mixture for a few sec.
Centrifuge at 2,600 g for 2–5 min.
Using a glass pipette, remove most of the upper organic layer carefully.
Repeat step 22–25 at least three times.
Note: According to our determination, the residual MPAA concentration is normally below 100 μM after such extraction treatment.
Critical: Keep all insoluble precipitation during steps 22–26. See troubleshooting 4[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec6.7].
Use N2 or Ar flow to blow off any residual ethyl acetate on the top of the aqueous solution.
Add-and-done desulfurization in one pot
Timing: 30 min
This section describes the one-pot add-and-done desulfurization procedure to generate H3Q5ser after the previous expressed protein ligation (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]).
Dilute the solution above by adding 1.6 mL desulfurization buffer.
Adjust the pH to 4.5 by 6 M NaOH. The final concentration of protein is approximately 0.5 mg/mL (36 μM).
Critical: The pH of the protein solution should be controlled between 4 and 5. See troubleshooting 5[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec6.9].

Add 48 μL 0.5 g/mL NaBEt4 solution through a pipette. The final concentration of NaBEt4 is around 50 mM.
Enclose the cap of the centrifuge tube and vortex the reaction mixture for 15–30 s.
Note: Intensive bubbling generation in this step is normal.
Centrifuge at 2,600 g for 1 min.
Check the desulfurization progress by UPLC as steps 14–16.
Note: The solution may be cloudy at first due to the formation of triethylborane. It will not affect the analysis and will gradually become clear after a few min.
Note: See troubleshooting 6[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec6.11].
Purification of H3Q5ser
Timing: 2 days
This section describes the purification of the final product H3Q5ser.
Dilute the reaction mixture from step 33 to 5.0 mL by 10% (vol/vol) ACN in H2O.
Filter the solution through 0.22 μM PTFE filter to a 15-mL centrifuge tube.
Centrifuge the filtered solution at 2,600 g for 2 min at room temperature (22°C–25°C).
Set up HPLC parameters according to the table in the materials and equipment[href=https://www.wicell.org#materials-and-equipment] section.
Inject 5.0 mL of sample from step 35 into the sample loop of a manual injector.
Turn the valve position from ‘Load’ to ‘Inject’ to trigger the HPLC UV acquisition.
Note: Waters HPLC was used at step 39 For other HPLC model, operation may be different and it should be referred to the official manual respectively.
Collect eluent with strong UV absorption.
Check fractions by UPLC to find out the desired product.
Lyophilize pure fractions to obtain the final product as a white powder.
